ARABIC: بَلِ ٱلَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا۟ فِى عِزَّةٍ وَشِقَاقٍ

ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: But those who are kafir are full of vainglory and entrenched in hostility.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: But the unbelievers are still full of pride and hostility.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: Nay, but the unbelievers are steeped in arrogance and stubborn defiance.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: In fact, the unbelievers are the ones who are boastful and quarrelsome.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: In fact, the disbelievers are in false pride and opposition.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: Those who disbelieve are in false pride and opposition.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: Nay! those who disbelieve are in self-exaltation and opposition.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: nay, but the unbelievers glory in their schism.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: Nay, but those who disbelieve are in false pride and schism.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: Those who deny the truth are steeped in arrogance and hostility.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: Verily those who disbelieve are in vainglory and shism.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: the faithless indeed dwell in conceit and defiance.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: But the Unbelievers (are steeped) in self-glory and Separatism.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: Nay, those who desbelieve are in false pride and opposition.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: No, the unbelievers exalt in their division.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: Those who disbelieve are steeped in arrogance and defiance.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: But those who disbelieve are in pride and dissension.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [38:2] Nay, but those who disbelieve, from among the people of Mecca, dwell in conceit, in self-glory and [in] disdain of faith, and defiance, disagreement with, and enmity towards, the Prophet (s).
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (Nay, but those who disbelieve) the disbelievers of Mecca (are in false pride and schism) dispute and enmity, and it is for this that Allah swore.
